result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrill L. Wallace #550358 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Terrill L. Wallace #550358 was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrill L. Wallace #550358 is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Terrill L. Wallace #550358 was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)3.
  • Terrill L. Wallace #550358 was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program, but not until 3 years of sentence has been served.  Defendant shall receive credit as listed below.  Sentence shall run on each count concurrent, but consecutive to any other imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit a payment with amount deemed appropriate by the agent on a monthly basis.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Anger Management as deemed appropriate.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Submit DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: on each count concurrent, but consecutive to any other imposed sentence.
on each count concurrent, but consecutive to any other imposed sentence with credit as listed below.
on each count concurrent, but consecutive to any other imposed sentence.
